title: "Nemesis Draft" Q&A with the Play team. 2/17, 10AM - 12PM PST
body:
Yo Everyone ^o^/

The latest Featured Game Mode, *“Nemesis Draft”* is currently live, and the Play team is here to field any questions or suggestions you guys might have! We make all of the Featured Game Modes, so feel free to ask us anything about *Nemesis Draft* (or any previous modes). What are the weirdest team compositions you played with so far? What's your favourite comp or strategy for giving champs to the enemy team? Are there any new champs you've discovered that are kinda fun to play? Tell us the story of your most epic match yet! ^_^

We’ll be online from now for 2 hours, from 10:00AM ~ 12:00PM PST.

-L4T3NCY
-BuffMePlz
-DefaultChar
-Beastfu
-Mixtli
-Ponts

EDIT: Ok guys, we're out for now. We'll still check in on this thread throughout the day and maybe answer a few more. Thanks for stopping by and asking us stuff! ^_^/

replies.body: Why did battle boosts return, and only for this mode.

Battle Boosts make the most sense when you don't really know who you might be playing. If it was a regular pick type, you might already have skins for your favourite champions, so the Battle Boost wouldn't really feel necessary.
Sorry if I'm a bit off-topic here, but what about adding Battle Boost to ARAM?
If you could only release one of all the game modes you have released so far which one would you choose?

My personal choice would be the Ascension Game Mode (with some clean up and polish) as it brought a breath of fresh air to the Crystal Scar map for a lot of players and offered alternative game play unlike our other maps and modes.
I'd go for Legend of the Poro King and Ascension... wups, that was two ;)

No.

I liked URF. A *lot*. The only problem I have with it returning is that all the people who used clog the boards and comments by incessantly demanding URF *again* and *again* would start yelling for URF back the very moment it stopped.

i think this mode would've worked way better with the Howling Abyss map .
why did u go with Summoner's Rift instead ?

Summoner's Rift has WAY more strategic options than Howling Abyss, making it a much more interesting choice for this kind of meta gameplay. Howling Abyss only has 1 objective (the next building) and your only option is essentially "to push" (making it not much of an option). Summoner's Rift affords the opportunity to let teamwork and strategy prevail over team comp, pushing multiple lanes, objectives, etc. Compared to Howling Abyss, Summoner's Rift is a candyland of strategic choice. :D
My question is pretty boring and dumb, but I can't find an answer anywhere: how do we earn the reward icon for Nemesis Draft? The FAQ wasn't very clear on that point.

The reward icon for Nemesis Draft is for *not dodging or AFK'ing during the course of the mode*. We're also leveraging the new LeaverBuster system to help us with this. ^_^b

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ

The icon will be awarded after the game mode has finished (as always, could take up to 2 weeks to show up in your account).

I was excited for the way champ select worked out too : (

How did you guys come up with the idea for this game mode?

Nemesis Draft was an idea we had when Featured Game Modes had just begun back in 2013. There was just never a good window of time between modes until now to polish and release it. It's a pick type that's been historically popular though in a variety of other genres since the beginning of time (fighting games, beat-em-ups, RTS's, etc). It was nigh time that League had some fun with it too. :)

Want a challenge!? Grab a group of 5 (don't want to enrage the randoms with your picks) and give the enemy team a sweet LCS Teamcomp! And yes, the ADC Nami's and Janna's sure are shinning bright on this gamemode! We tried our luck against the Jarvan+Gnar with the Kalista+Thresh and infamous Ahri mid on this patch.
http://puu.sh/g2DZ9/56ad04d055.jpg

EDIT: Round 2! The Nunu+Galio bot lane is the definition of synergy. Never have i been able to freely charge up such ripe Nunu ults thanks to Galios ult :D
http://puu.sh/g2WGJ/5907922397.jpg

-- On a side note..   "If someone misses their pick it should default to random! Then you can save average players making the new mistake missing the icon and players who deliberately close their client would be the only ones punished."

I'm curious as to whether you guy (and gals!) over at riot are recording data on this gametype and finding an interest who (in terms of champs) is getting picked the most and how they are getting played.

Is any pick information from Nemesis Draft of any statistical value to you?

Do you think the champions picked the most during this event also prove to be the most misunderstood?

Will this draft help point out champions that would benefit from better clarity in their kit?

Thanks!~

There's nothing new that Nemesis Draft can show us in terms of balance, popularity, etc that the Balance Team won't already know. 

What *is* interesting though is the mirror this will hold up to players and the community reflecting their *own* perceptions of what is strong or weak, and how they deal with those reactions. ^_-

Are you guys using data from Nemesis Draft as a data point on the general perceptions of champions?

It's not a big surprise that I see champions like Eve, Yorick, and Urgot given out frequently, but it *was* fairly shocking for me the first time I realized exactly how badly people at my level undervalued support picks. I've ended up against teams with four supports, then got blamed for the loss because I gave the enemy Rumble or someone else without useful CC.

I sure ain't Riot, but I want to drop a little something on this. How is it "not a big surprise that [you] see champions like  {{champion:28}} ,  {{champion:83}} , and  {{champion:6}} "? I have come to the conclusion that {{champion:6}}  is a big of a community wide joke, but anybody with enough brain functionality to read over his move set and build accordingly would know that he can easily be a power house if you give him a chance (Triforce + manamune on his Q after locking it with the grenade? Good like fighting that). Similarly, {{champion:83}}  is one of the strongest champions I can think of, being a huge lane bully, a massive sustaining tank, and having a godly amount of damage. Finally, I'm going to throw in this little [Hyperlink](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1729411601/202213646?tab=overview) for an {{champion:28}}  game of mine. I had no clue what I was doing, built hybrid with a Juggernaut enchantment (what the hell was I doing?) and then somehow went 23/5/10.

I want the opinion on somebody up at Riot, is there any bad champions? Personally, I see this game mode more as "Make a bad team comp", because there is no bad champions. Give the entire team adc's and then rush thornmail? That's one option. Make them all supports? That's a terrible idea because supports are the sleeper cells of the League that only hold back their power so that {{champion:81}}  players can feel useful in the world.

I suppose that in final, here's a few questions.
* What champions did you expect to be played?
 Were you surprised by the champions who became used often?
 Why do people think supports are weak? Seriously, I saw an AP/Tank/Triforce {{champion:12}}  (in the {{champion:28}} game) who almost carried.

I don't think we'll get any information that will be actionable for us in terms of balance or kit changes that the Live Balance guys don't already know about.  That being said I think we'll see some interesting things in terms of which champions players most like to see their opponents playing and what types of team comps players perceive to be weak.  I want to reiterate though that I'd be surprised if we saw anything in Nemesis Mode that we didn't already know from normal/ranked play.

As to the supports comment, I'd like to turn your attention to the video link below.  At the time these Rioters were in the topish section of players on LIVE (1800 to 2100 Elo).  Now that supports scale so well when they aren't giving all their moneys to the ADC it's even more scary!  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h95HtcUJSCg (Man that old League of Legends...how far we've come :) )
What if I accidentally forgot to choose a champion for the enemy team while talking strategy on what we got assigned? Does that count as dodging or do I still have a chance of obtaining the icon?

I like Nemesis Mode but the drafts are a bit stale.  Would there be any way of making maybe a Nemesis Mode where the "donation" pool is randomized, lending a little more variety to the champs in these matches?

We decided to use players' owned champion pools so that there was some agency over what you gave other players (e.g. you can only give what you own) - in many ways, this should have made champion select *less* stale, as you couldn't ban, say, Urgot, if you don't own him, thus avoiding the Urgot ban/pick in *every* game.

That said, a randomized draft pool probably would have made things pretty interesting.  Definitely something to consider if we bring this one back, or as a separate pick type in and of itself.

I ,along with a ton of the community, would love to know what you guys/gals have up your sleeves for Ultra Rapid Fire Mode. It was by far in my eyes the best game mode and would love to see the return once and for all. On top of this question what can you say about bringing back old modes (such as URF) permanently or at least in custom games? Thanks guys keep up the great work!

so i feel that nemisis was like an easy one to code as far as game modes go, was this more of a get bye game mode oro was this really compicated?  Also why has yorick never been free??? E-V-E-R benn free?

While Nemesis Draft didn't really affect the in-game play, it did require changes to other systems not originally meant for how we flipped things around. Typically, there are several parts of the software ecosystem that need altering in one way or another for each of the Featured Game Modes. Overall, I'd say that while there were definitely challenges in champ select, Nemesis Draft ended up being not too crazy though.
